![medium](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/medium-priority.svg)

This implementation equates `em` and `rem` units. While `rem` is always relative to the root font size, `em` is relative to the font size of its parent element. This implementation assumes the context for `em` is the same as for `rem` (the root element), which might not always be the case and could be confusing for users. Consider adding a note in the UI to clarify this assumption, as the current comment is only visible in the code.

The root font size should be a positive number. To improve user experience and prevent invalid values, consider adding a `min="1"` attribute to this input. This provides browser-level validation against negative numbers or zero, though you should still keep your component's logic robust against invalid values typed by the user.
